questions.question: The boy …………………… playing the piano.
questions.description: We use is here because the subject is the singular countable noun boy.

questions.question: We ………………………… sent the parcel.
questions.description: We use the present perfect to talk about recently finished actions or situations. This verb form is made with has or have.

questions.question: I have ……………………… working since morning.
questions.description: We make the present perfect continuous tense forms with have been + ing form.

questions.question: Uncle said that he ………………………. come with me.
questions.description: Would is the past tense of will in reported speech.

questions.question: I ………………………….. visit the beach when I was in Mumbai.
questions.description: We use used to to talk about a past habit.

questions.question: He …………………………. not go out alone at night.
questions.description: When dare is used as a modal auxiliary, it does not the take the marker –s.

questions.question: She ……………………………. to speak to me.
questions.description: When dare is used as an ordinary verb, it is followed by an infinitive with to. Also, questions and negatives are made with do and does.

questions.question: You …………………………. write to him.
questions.description: When need is used as a modal auxiliary, questions and negatives are made without do and does.

questions.question: You don’t need ……………………….. for me.
questions.description: When need is used as an ordinary verb, it is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: You …………………………… have told me before borrowing my car.
questions.description: We use should to indicate obligation.

questions.question: …………………………. I carry this bag for you?
questions.description: Should is used in polite offers of help.

questions.question: ………………………….. you help me with cooking?
questions.description: Would is used in polite requests for help.
